pages.content: Once upon a time, there was a very hungry caterpillar.
pages.html_content: Once upon a time, there was a very hungry caterpillar.

pages.content: He ate through one apple on Monday, two pears on Tuesday, and so on.
pages.html_content: He ate through one apple on Monday, two pears on Tuesday, and so on.

pages.content: By the end of the week, the caterpillar had eaten so much that he spun a cocoon around himself.
pages.html_content: By the end of the week, the caterpillar had eaten so much that he spun a cocoon around himself.

pages.content: Inside the cocoon, the caterpillar transformed into a butterfly.

pages.content: The butterfly emerged from the cocoon and spread its wings.

pages.content: It fluttered its wings and flew away.

pages.content: And the caterpillar was no longer hungry, but was now a beautiful butterfly.

pages.content: Once there was a tree... and she loved a little boy.

pages.content: Once upon a time, there was a little blue engine that wanted to pull a long train of toys to the children on the other side of the mountain.
pages.html_content: Once upon a time, there was a little blue engine that wanted to pull a long train of toys to the children on the other side of the mountain.

pages.content: But the other engines said, 'You're too little, you can't do it.'
pages.html_content: But the other engines said, 'You're too little, you can't do it.'

pages.content: The little engine didn't give up. She said, 'I think I can, I think I can.'
pages.html_content: The little engine didn't give up. She said, 'I think I can, I think I can.'

pages.content: And with a chug, chug, chug, she started up the mountain with the train of toys.
pages.html_content: And with a chug, chug, chug, she started up the mountain with the train of toys.

pages.content: She didn't give up, even when the grade was steep and the load was heavy.
pages.html_content: She didn't give up, even when the grade was steep and the load was heavy.

pages.content: And she made it to the top of the mountain, and delivered the toys to the children.
pages.html_content: And she made it to the top of the mountain, and delivered the toys to the children.

pages.content: The other engines were amazed, and they said, 'You did it! You're not too little after all!'
pages.html_content: The other engines were amazed, and they said, 'You did it! You're not too little after all!'

pages.content: The little engine was so happy, and she said, 'I knew I could, I knew I could.'

pages.content: And from that day on, she was known as the Little Engine That Could.
